mods.abstract: RUN-AWAY From the undersigned, at Queue Tortue, in this Parish, on the 23rd. instant,a Mulatto-man, named Peter, aged about 25 or 30 years, 6 feet high, and very start built, having a scar across the end of the nose, speaking french and english. I have good reason to believe that said boy runaway with a certain Noë Huffpower, taking with them two creole horses, on a bay horse, blind of the right eye, the other a white face bay, both branded about thus: ( ) with two saddles and bridles. A reasonable reward will be given for the delivery of said boy and horses to the undersigned, or lodge in one of the jails of this State. MAXIMILIEN LEBLANC. The Point Coupée Echo and Natchitoches Chronicle will publish the above one month, in french and english, and forward their bills to the Opelousas Courier. M.L. Opelousas, 29th Jan. 1853.--5t.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
